greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n/6^m mod 6, where 6^m is the greatest power of 6 that divides n.
comment: a(n) is the rightmost nonzero digit in the base 6 expansion of n.
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 19 2016
